abstract: Chief Judge Jorge A Solis of United States District Court rules 28 intellectually disabled men are owed almost $600,000, or about $25,000 each, for their work in turkey processing plant in Iowa for Texas-based company Henry's Turkey Service; men were rescued from virtual servitude in 2009, and ruling overrides confidential settlement that would have diverted hundreds of thousands of dollars owed to men to heirs of company's owners.
lead_paragraph: More than two dozen men with intellectual disabilities who worked decades for little pay in a turkey-processing plant will share the money.

headline.main: Judge’s Ruling Awards $600,000 to Exploited Workers
headline.print_headline: Judge’s Ruling Awards $600,000 to Exploited Workers

snippet: More than two dozen men with intellectual disabilities who worked decades for little pay in a turkey-processing plant will share the money.
